documents.content: Malaysian storytelling incorporates elements from various cultures: Malay folklore (hantu, orang bunian), Chinese mythology (naga, phoenix), and Indian epics. Modern Malaysian stories often blend these traditional elements with contemporary urban settings.

Pantun is a Malay poetic form with ABAB rhyme scheme. Each line typically has 8-12 syllables. The first two lines provide imagery (pembayang), while the last two deliver the message (maksud). Example: Pisang emas dibawa belayar, Masak sebiji di atas peti, Hutang emas boleh dibayar, Hutang budi dibawa mati.
